content.question: A beam of electrons with the same de Broglie wavelength is directed through a narrow slit whose width is about the same size as the electronsâ€™ wavelength. Electrons travel toward a detector that measures electron speed. The detector initially measures the speed of the electrons as <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. A thick lead plate is then placed halfway between the source and detector, as shown, that absorbs all the electrons that hit it. Which of the following predictions is correct about how the new electron speed <math alttext="v sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> measured by the detector compares with <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>?

Some electrons diffracted by the slit will also be diffracted by the plate, and they will lose energy due to their interaction with the plate.

<math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Some electrons diffracted by the slit will also be diffracted by the plate, and only the fastest electrons will arrive at the detector.

<math alttext="v sub 1 is equal to v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Some electrons diffracted by the slit will also diffract around the plate, without affecting the electron speed.

<math alttext="v sub 1 is equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the plate will prevent all the electrons from reaching the detector.
